column4: I'm trying to remove nautilus from my gnome session (by setting its style to trash), but it keeps coming back!
i.e. set its style to trash, log out, log back in (and it's not there), log out, log back in (it's back!)
how do I get rid of it!?
how are you setting its style to trash? and also, is this a theme?
your nautilus style. Did you download it from gnome-look.org or something similar?
... nautilus... style?   I did install a theme, maybe that's it.  But I think it's just a gtk theme.
you may want to try using another theme and see if it fixes the problem. if it does, you may even know where to go from there so you can use the previous theme without it affecting nautilus.
no problem. If you're trying to get rid of nautilus all together, what do you plan to use?
your other option, tho IMO undesirable is to uninstall nautilus and install xmonad. Create a symbolic link of xmonad and call it nautilus.
yeah, first, that's system wide, and second, eeww :-)
